'Wesleyan University' is a private liberal arts college in Middletown,
Connecticut, USA, founded in 1831. Wesleyan is the only Baccalaureate College in
the nation that emphasizes undergraduate instruction in the arts and sciences,
also provides graduate research in many academic disciplines, and grants PhD
degrees primarily in the sciences and
mathematics. Wesleyan is the second
most productive liberal arts college in the United States with respect to the
number of undergraduates who go on to earn PhDs in all fields of study. [http://oberlin.edu/instres/irhome/assessment/phd.html
Baccalaureate Origins of PhD 1999â2008], Oberlin College. Retrieved 15 February
2011. [http://www.swarthmore.ed-
u/Documents/administration/ir/BaccOrigins05.pdf Doctorates Awarded to Graduates
of Liberal Arts Colleges, FY 2005; Top 25 Liberal Arts Colleges], Swarthmore
College. Retrieved 17 February 2011. [http://www.stolaf.edu/offices/ir/alumni/BacOrigins.htm St. Olaf
College | IR: Bac Origins of PhDs 2008]. Stolaf.edu. Retrieved on 17 October
2011. [http://www.nsf.gov/statistics/doctorates/pdf/sed2003.pdf Doctorate
Recipients from United States Universities: Summary Report 2003], Survey of
Earned Doctorates (sponsored by the National Science Foundation, the National
Institutes of Health, the U.S. Department of Education, the National Endowment
for the Humanities, the U.S. Department of Agriculture, and the National
Aeronautics and Space Administration. p. 81 (p. 89 of PDF). Retrieved 17
February 2011.

Founded under the auspices of the Methodist Episcopal Church and with the
support of prominent residents of Middletown, the now secular university was the
first institution of higher education to be named after John Wesley, the founder
of Methodism. About 20 unrelated colleges and universities were subsequently
named after Wesley. Wesleyan, along with Amherst College and Williams College,
is a member of the historic Little Three colleges and is known as one of the
Little Ivies.
